org.ensembl.datamodel
Interface SequenceEdit

public interface SequenceEdit

A sequence modification action.

Author:
Craig Melsopp

getDescription

public java.lang.String getDescription()
Description for this sequence edit.

Returns:
description for this sequence edit.

getStart

public int getStart()
The start position of the region replaced by the alternative sequence. Coordinates are inclusive and one-based, which means that inserts are unusually represented by a start 1bp higher than the end. E.g. start = 1, end = 1 is a replacement of the first base but start = 1, end = 0 is an insert BEFORE the first base.

Returns:
The start position of the region replaced by the alternative sequence.

getEnd

public int getEnd()
The end position of the region replaced by the alternative sequence. Coordinates are inclusive and one-based, which means that inserts are unusually represented by a start 1bp higher than the end. E.g. start = 1, end = 1 is a replacement of the first base but start = 1, end = 0 is an insert BEFORE the first base.

Returns:
The end position of the region replaced by the alternative sequence.

getAlternativeSequence

public java.lang.String getAlternativeSequence()
The replacement sequence used by this edit. The sequence may either be a string of amino acids or nucleotides depending on the context in which this edit is used. In the case of a deletion the replacement sequence is an empty string.

Returns:
The replacement sequence used by this edit.

applyEdit

public java.lang.String applyEdit(java.lang.String sourceSequence)
Creates a new sequence that is the original with this sequence applied to to it.

Parameters:
sourceSequence - source sequence.
Returns:
modified sequence.

lengthDiff

public int lengthDiff()
The difference in length caused by applying this edit to a sequence.

Returns:
The difference in length caused by applying this edit to a sequence. This may be be negative (deletion), positive (insertion) or 0 (replacement). If either start or end are not defined 0 is returned.
